meanings.definition: To become plump or fuller in size or shape.
meanings.sent1: After eating lots of healthy food, the cat started to plumpen up.
meanings.sent2: The balloon began to plumpen as more air was blown into it.
meanings.sent3: The pumpkin plumpened so much that it rolled off the table!
meanings.sent4: Her cheeks plumpened like ripe peaches in the warm sun.
meanings.sent5: The flowers plumpened with water after a refreshing rain shower.

meanings.definition: To make something plump or fuller in size or shape.
meanings.sent1: She used extra stuffing to plumpen up the pillow.
meanings.sent2: The baker added more yeast to the dough to plumpen it.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to plumpen the soup with extra vegetables.
meanings.sent4: The artist plumpened the lines in the drawing to make it more defined.
meanings.sent5: The farmer plumpened the tomatoes by giving them plenty of sunlight.
